item.title: Multiple pot holes and uneven road surface., 18th January
item.description:
I am writing to raise an urgent concern regarding the extremely poor condition of Brookend Road. The road is riddled with multiple potholes, and the surface has become dangerously uneven throughout. There is now a patchwork of different surface types which creates an unsafe environment for cars, motorbikes, and cyclists alike. It is evident that the street has not been properly resurfaced in decades, and its current state poses a genuine risk to road users. I request that the council inspect Brookend Road as soon as possible and take immediate action to repair and resurface it to ensure the safety of everyone who relies on it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Brookend Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Probable abandonned car ?, 18th January
item.description:
Seemingly abandoned car in Westgate Road Beckenham, just round corner from Albemarle Road. Parked about a foot from the kerb in same position for about 6 months. Untaxed and no MOT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westgate Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Excessive litter and flytipping from 67 Queen's Drive, 18th January
item.description:
Once again, the pavement outside this property has been left in an unacceptable condition due to fly-tipping and loose rubbish being spread across the public walkway. The waste is scattered widely, obstructing the pavement and neighbouring entrances.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 abandoned cars outside, 18th January
item.description:

item.description:

item.description:
